Class ProcessUtilities

java.lang.Object
  edu.nyu.cs.javagit.client.cli.ProcessUtilities

public class ProcessUtilities
extends java.lang.Object

ProcessUtilities contains methods to help managing processes.

Method Detail

startProcess

public static java.lang.Process startProcess(java.lang.ProcessBuilder pb)
                                      throws java.io.IOException
Start a process.

Parameters:
pb - The ProcessBuilder to use to start the process.
Returns:
The started process.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - An IOException is thrown if there is trouble starting the sub-process.

getProcessOutput

public static void getProcessOutput(java.lang.Process p,
                                    IParser parser)
                             throws java.io.IOException
Reads the output from the process and prints it to stdout.

Parameters:
p - The process from which to read the output.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - An IOException is thrown if there is trouble reading input from the sub-process.

waitForAndDestroyProcess

public static int waitForAndDestroyProcess(java.lang.Process p,
                                           IParser parser)
Waits for a process to terminate and then destroys it.

Parameters:
p - The process to wait for and destroy.
Returns:
The exit value of the process. By convention, 0 indicates normal termination.

runCommand

public static CommandResponse runCommand(java.io.File workingDirectory,
                                         java.util.List<java.lang.String> commandLine,
                                         IParser parser)
                                  throws java.io.IOException,
                                         JavaGitException
Runs the command specified in the command line with the specified working directory. The IParser is used to parse the response given by the command line.

Parameters:
workingDirectory - The working directory in with which to start the process.
commandLine - The command line to run.
parser - The parser to use to parse the command line's response.
Returns:
The command response from the IParser.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown if there are problems with the subprocess.
JavaGitException
